text: I am noticing a behavior that, if I understanding whats happening correctly, was a bit surprising
it seems to me that “enrollment” is a one-time event (meaning, once you enroll with a user/password, you can never use the user/password again, you have to persist the enrollment material
is this accurate?
its probably more of an issue in development than production, but it caught me off guard
e.g. if I discard the SDK kvstore material, I cannot re-use that identity via username/password without resetting the membersrvc database too
(my expectation was that the username/password was the credential, not the enrollment material that was returned
hi <@U0KPFAZNF>, yes, once the certificates are created the user is not able to use another peer. This situation is being addressed
oh i didnt even realize that particular restriction
mine was that I found that devel iterations had to preserve the kvstore or I couldnt log in again
yep, it’s almost the same situation you described
but, i suppose I dont know what was actually rejecting me
I was getting something like “Identity token invalid …"
yes
perhaps it was the peer that was rejecting me
(I assumed it was the ca)
actually it’s eca who is rejecting it
ok
<@U11L9NAUW> is working on that
good that someone is working on it at least, i can work around it for now by just being more careful with the persistence management
thank you, <@U17BRDHPG>
sure
